article.headline: Kim Kardashianâs KKW Beauty gets a $1 billion valuation, but thatâs 15% less than Kylie Jennerâs beauty brand
article.body: The difference between being one of the most recognized people in the world and being one of the most admired is worth about $180 million dollars, according to global beauty company Coty. Inc. Coty COTY, -5.08% announced Monday a âstrategic relationshipâ in which it paid $200 million for a 20% stake in reality TV star Kim Kardashian Westâs beauty business, KKW Beauty. Under terms of the deal, Coty will be responsible for the âportfolioâs developmentâ in skin care, haircare, personal care and nail products, and Kardashian West will âlead all creative efforts in terms of product and communication initiatives.â The investment implies a $1 billion valuation for KKW Beauty. Coty had disclosed earlier this month that it was in talks with Kardashian West regarding a possible collaboration. The deal comes less than a week after Kimâs husband Kanye West and Gap Inc. GPS, -0.10% Â announced a partnership in which Kanye will launch a Yeezy Gap collection next year. Wells Fargo analyst Joe Lachky said he didnât expect the deal to have a material impact on Cotyâs financials in the near term, given the small ownership stake, but he said it could become âmore materialâ over time as it includes a licensing agreement that puts Coty in charge of expanding the brand outside of cosmetics and fragrance. Cotyâs stock COTY, -5.08% Â soared 13.4% to $4.74. It has lost 57.9% year to date, while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87% Â has slipped 5.5%. Meanwhile, the language in Cotyâs release Monday was similar to that used in an investment the company closed six months ago with Kimâs younger half sister, Kylie Jenner. In January, Coty said it closed on the âstrategic partnershipâ announced in November 2019, in which Coty said it paid $600 million for a 51% stake in Kylieâs beauty business, Kylie Cosmetics. That implies a $1.18 billion valuation for Kylie Cosmetics. Donât miss: Cotyâs $600 million deal with Kylie Jenner is designed to hang on to her social media star power. At that time, Coty said it would be responsible for the âportfolioâs development,â while Jenner will âlead all creative efforts in terms of product and communications initiatives.â There was a not-too-subtle difference, however, in the language Coty used to describe the sisters. On Monday, Coty said about Kim: âKaradashian West is one of the worldâs most recognized personalities with 300 million followers across her personal and brand social media channels, as well as being an influential voice among beauty consumers globally,â Coty said in a statement. In November, Coty said about Kylie: âKylie is one of the worldâs most admired personalities with over 270 million followers across her personal and brand social media channels, as well as being one of the most influential voices among beauty consumers globally.â Apparently, being admired is worth a lot more than being recognized.
